column1: Smoque BBQ////They did what most people should do- go to the people and learn how to BBQ properly. The brisket was moist
column2: properly seasons (one spice didn't overpower the other- I wasn't trying to figure it out
column3: I just wanted to eat). If you spend a few extra dollars
column4: you can get a nice slaw and two sides. The mac & cheese was rock solid. I decided to go with fries and they were also very good (note- I don't eat fries much anymore
column5: so someone else finished them off for me). If you say you can make a good brisket but whiff
